The article introduces the following data simulation techniques:

1. Back-translation (BT)
2. Forward-translation (FT)
3. Copying the target side of the corpus
4. Copying the target side of the corpus with noise
5. Copying the target side of the corpus with a special mark to avoid confusion with homographic words
6. Replacing words with "dummy" tokens
7. Using Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) to generate pseudo-sources that are closer to natural data
76ed74788e3eb3321e646c48ae8bf6cdfe46dca1:
The article mentions the following linguistics features:

1. POS (Part-of-speech) tags
2. Morphological features (stem templates)
3. Syntactic features (case-endings)
4. Surface-level features (character-level features, segmentation information)
5. Syntactic features (dependency parsing)
6. Morphological features (bigram language model)
7. Syntactic features (named entities)
8. Morphological features (gazetteers of named entities)
9. Syntactic features (POS tagging)
10. Morphological features (indeclinability)
